name: Jewel Runaway Bay Beach & Golf Resort

reviews.text: There are TONS of resorts in Jamaica and I'm sure they are all wonderful, but I now consider Jewel Runaway Bay my new home!!!!! It was myself and my best friend on our girls' trip. I had never been out of the US so this trip was AMAZING to me!The staff was absolutely amazing and very welcoming. We wanted for nothing. The guys in the photo shop became our best friends (Kevin, Roan, and Teva). Our room was beautiful, simple but a classic room. We had a great view of the grounds and the Japanese steak house. The food was okay, they could stand to work on that. The american grill is probably where I ate most of my meals. Buffet breakfast was descent but lunch and dinner weren't so great. The bartenders were amazing! Shout out to the greatest lady ever.....Simone!!!! Also I must recognize Clayton and Fredereik. The pool areas were very nice, I spent the majority of my time at the bar pool. The beaches are well kept and raked every morning. Some complained about towel service, but anytime I needed a beach/pool towel, they were available. I was totally happy with this resort and i WILL be returning.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL!!!!!!!

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at the Jewel in Runaway Bay! We rented a car and drove about an hour from the airport in Montego to get there. Property is well-kept, beach is nice and our room was very clean. We had a mini-fridge in-room, a large bathroom with tall mirrors and spacious closet. Locking safe was large enough for a laptop. Staff was all very friendly and fun. Gift shop has t-shirts and souvenirs along with necessary items such as sunscreen and shaving razors. The kids (8 and 9) enjoyed the gameroom, with pool table, foosball, video games, and 'virgin' frozen drinks. Nice rooftop finess room with equipment. Food was delicious with a wide variety of dining options to choose from: always could find something that the kids would eat- we tried coconut pizza for the first time- it was yummy! The infinity pool is georgeous, complete with swim-up bar, and fresh beach towels. There was a lifeguard on duty at the pools and beach. Lots of drinks, and great coffee at Jaspers. Close to Ochos Rios, which has many things to do. We would definitely stay here again, 5 of 5 stars!
reviews.title: Great family vacation!!

reviews.text: My party had 5 people in it and we all agree that this resort was the worst any of the five of us has ever stayed at.
reviews.title: Beware: Don't go to this resort; They let locals use the facility on weekends, allow cruise ship day passes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the resort, there was so much confusion, no one greeted us or told us where to go to check in. Upon locating the check in desk, we got the room keys and instead of the front desk arranging for the bellman to escort us to our rooms, we had to locate someone to pick up our bags and then get them to the rooms. He had no idea of which rooms were even ours.
reviews.title: Not my favorite

reviews.text: The rooms were on the second floor and there was no elevator! One person in our group was my 84 year old Mother, who has difficulty breathing so the walk to the rooms was not comfortable for her. The rooms are outdated, not pleasant, with mismatched furniture, old fixtures, dirty surroundings, loud non-stop air conditioner and the bellhop did not attempt to show us where anything was located in the rooms.
reviews.title: There's a first time for everything...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on the many positive reviews before our vacation; both my wife and I expected to have a great vacation and were eagerly anticipating our trip. JRB was all we expected it to be plus more!
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

reviews.text: Included transportation from Montego Bay was prompt and efficient with no wait time at the airport and a comfortable vehicle for the scenic hour ride.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Greeted at Jewell with a handshake, drink and comfortable seat in the beautiful lobby while the lovely Shereka did all the work. Quick trip to our room with points of interest along the way and an offer to arrange for another room if the hike to third floor was more than we desired.
reviews.title: Our first Jamaica Visit

reviews.text: Many comments have previously been made about the rooms in a negative vein - such as "outdated". "hotel like" "too plain". Sometimes I wonder what folks come to a beautiful island like Jamaica to see? The room was clean, very large and furnished comfortably with a view worth twice the price. We booked an OF Jr. Suite so it included a mini-fridge which was stocked with water, juice, soda and Red Stripe along with a bottle of Champagne to help celebrate our anniversary. The thoughtful staff also had a plate of heart shaped chocolate brownies to accompany a "congratulations on your anniversary" note. Thoughtful touches which are appreciated after a long trip.Bathroom was well stocked with quality amenities and wonderful shower with jets coming from all directions. Room was maintained well daily and concierge (thank you Keisha for your assistance and smile) promptly arranged to provide anything needed-extra water, new coffee pot, etc.
reviews.title: Family Vacation in Jamaica

reviews.text: The room was more than adequate and very comfortable for the little time we were in it.
reviews.title: Unbelievable Value and Service

reviews.text: entertainment was also a big plus as were the beautiful spacious beaches and very well manicured grounds.
reviews.title: decent value for money

reviews.text: Just returned from 7 night stay at resort. I actually tried to find a staff member that was rude or not accomodating and couldn't find one. I have never been treated so well as I have at this resort. I am definitely coming back.
reviews.title: Awesome time

reviews.text: The kids club has limited facilities but really, really great staff. They do a brilliant buggy ride to the ranch.
reviews.title: Relaxing Trip

reviews.text: We stayed in a junior suite, and it was huge, and nicely finished, its definately worth paying more for a junior suite.
reviews.title: fantastic stay

reviews.text: In parts jewel felt like a bit of a poor mans sandals, including some of the same types of restaurants that beaches (sandals for families) on the island offer.
reviews.title: Yeah Mon!

reviews.text: Runaway Bay has a guard at the end of the property to prevent anyone who is not a registered guest from entering the property. I saw no evidence of cruise ship passengers with day passes. This is a somewhat small property located in St. Anne Jamaica. There are three pools and two hot tubs. One hot tub is 110 F and the other with a view of the sea is much cooler. The beach and pools have life guards who are on duty until 6:00 pm. In January there are plans to build a water park at the eastern end of the property.
reviews.title: A great place for sun and fun in Jamaica

reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and check-in / check-out is run very smoothly. One of the food staff goes by the name of "Egg Boy" is a real character. No matter where you say you are from he clams to have been there and even knows the names of towns near your home town.
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.text: The grounds are kept up immaculately. If you ask one of the grounds keepers he will climb a coconut tree and cut open a coconut for you to drink the coconut water.
reviews.title: Amazing vacation

reviews.text: The beach side grill has some of the best jerk chicken I have ever tasted! The beach is small but adequate for the number of guests using it. Blue and yellow Sargent Major fish swim in schools at the deep end of the beach. The use of sail boats are free as is rental of snorkel equipment. There is also a free glass bottom boat ride to view the coral reefs.
reviews.title: From a Jamaican

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was immaculate and housekeeping very accommodating to any special requests. At night there is a turn-down service with towel sculptures.
reviews.title: The staff is great, hotel needs work.

reviews.text: The Jewel Runaway Bay celebrated its first anniversary in june. It had been a Breezes family resort and continues that tradition. The property has 266 rooms located in 4 buildings with 7 different room categories. I stayed in their premier or first category and the room was spacious, bathroom large with flat screen tv, stocked room fridge with pop and water, large balcony, ac and inroom safe. The bed was comfortable and the room spotless. The wifi was available in the room for $15/day, free in the lobby and included in the highest categories of rooms. Furniture is being changed as we speak to update the rooms. There are interconnecting rooms available thruout the resort. Building 4 is all suites and butler suites. a quieter location, yet close to amenities.
reviews.title: a Family Jewel.

reviews.text: There are six restaurants available for you with a beach grill, coral cafe buffet -awesome breakfast, fire-oven pizza, and then the a la cartes. We ate at the Jade Samurai with teppanyaki style entertainment. Sexy Bubba was a lot of fun mixing in Jamaican history, a poke of fun with everyone participating and an excellent meal. I highly recommend this experience. We also had the chance to try the Moonstone by Vincenzo, their Italian a la carte and it also gave you a great eating experience. I was only here 2 nights so tried to fit in as much as possible.
reviews.title: A little bit of paradise

reviews.text: The large pool was located in the middle of the complex and was huge. Also not far from the beach, which was a little rough the eve of our arrival. Lots of chairs everywhere to rest and enjoy. There is also a splash pool for the children, along with an infinity pool. For the beach, they have nonmotorized sports, snorkelling, and a glassbottom boat for those who don't snorkel. The resort is also a padi center with the opportunity of getting your diving certification.
reviews.title: Inconsistent Service

aka: Breezes Runaway Bay Resort & Golf Club Hotel
description: Jewel Runaway Bay Beach & Golf Resort, one of the most complete all-inclusive resorts in the world. Located on 22 lush, oceanfront acres of Jamaica's famed north coast, this spectacular resort offers some of the best SCUBA and golf on the island. Unwind in our new plunge pool suites. Indulge in our new full-service spa. Dine around at up to 5 different restaurants and 5 different free-flowing bars including a swim-up pool bar.
